alert.note: Alert for Larimer (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 11 at 4:36PM MDT until June 11 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE CAMERON PEAK BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL LARIMER COUNTY... At 436 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Cameron Peak Burn Scar. Between 0.3 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Cameron Peak Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Cameron Peak Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kinikinik and Rustic. This includes the following additional locations... Monument Gulch, Jacks Gulch, Lower Pingree Park Road, Gulches along Highway 14 near and above Rustic, Pingree Hill, Goodell Corner, Bellaire Lake and Crown Point Road. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. THIS IS A LIFE THREATENING SITUATION! Heavy Rainfall will cause extensive and severe flooding of creeks, streams, roads and culverts in the affected part of the Cameron Peak burn area. Rock slides or debris flows can also be expected across roads in the warning area.
